intro: Ixora pruinosa, commonly known as the velvet ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, bright orange-red flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Ixora pruinosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a landscape plant.
